Positive: A patient testing positive for petit mal seizures may experience sudden and brief lapses in awareness or responsiveness. These seizures typically last for a few seconds to half a minute and may cause the individual to stare blankly, have rapid eye blinking or other subtle movements. The patient may also experience frequent episodes of these seizures throughout the day, which can disrupt daily activities and affect concentration and memory.
Negative: A patient testing negative for petit mal seizures would not exhibit the characteristic symptoms of sudden lapses in awareness or responsiveness. They would not have frequent episodes of staring spells or rapid eye blinking, and would not experience disruptions in concentration or memory due to petit mal seizures.
